page.title: 05COMBE
page.content: The only residential part in our area is the north end of Combe. The first house to be built in this end was in 1909. Shortly after this some council houses were built but these are now privately owned. The reasons for the growth of Combe are increased car ownership and the opening of Combe halt. People can live in Combe and work elsewhere. The older houses in the north part of Combe are almost all made of brick under a Stonesfield slate roof. Many have dry stone garden walls. We have written more about the houses of Combe on page 6 and a report about the amenities in Combe is included in an interview we did with a long time resident of Combe, Mrs Calcott, and have written on page 10.
